sense.name: athletics
sense.commentary: an active diversion requiring physical exertion and competition
sense.examples: John is very good at sports. George is very good at watching sports. My sport is basketball.

sense.name: teasing
sense.commentary: fun, play, sport - verbal wit (often at another's expense but not to be taken seriously)
sense.examples: They made a sport of teasing him. He became a figure of fun.

sense.name: mutation
sense.commentary: mutant, variation - an organism that has characteristics resulting from chromosomal alteration
sense.examples: The biologists determined that it is a sport form of the fungus.

sense.name: temp resident
sense.commentary: Maine colloquial - a temporary summer resident of inland Maine
sense.examples: It won't work out because George is a sport and Suzy is a local.
